intro: Korupodendron songweanum, commonly known as the Songwe mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Tanzania. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow and red. The plant has palmately lobed leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in montane forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
